intro: Rechsteineria weberbaueri, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in a fine layer of white hair, which helps reduce water loss. Rechsteineria weberbaueri is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
